00007 #include "mexopencv.hpp"
00008 using namespace std;
00009 using namespace cv;
00010 
00020 void mexFunction( int nlhs, mxArray *plhs[],
00021                   int nrhs, const mxArray *prhs[] )
00022 {
00023     // Check the number of arguments
00024     if (nrhs<2 || (nrhs%2)==1 || nlhs>1)
00025         mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Wrong number of arguments");
00026 
00027     // Argument vector
00028     vector<MxArray> rhs(prhs,prhs+nrhs);
00029     
00030     // Option processing
00031     Point anchor(-1,-1);
00032     int ddepth = -1;
00033     int delta = 0;
00034     int borderType = BORDER_DEFAULT;
00035     for (int i=2; i<nrhs; i+=2) {
00036         string key = rhs[i].toString();
00037         if (key=="Anchor")
00038             anchor = rhs[i+1].toPoint();
00039         else if (key=="DDepth")
00040             ddepth = rhs[i+1].toInt();
00041         else if (key=="Delta")
00042             delta = rhs[i+1].toInt();
00043         else if (key=="BorderType")
00044             borderType = BorderType[rhs[i+1].toString()];
00045         else
00046             mexErrMsgIdAndTxt("mexopencv:error","Unrecognized option");
00047     }
00048     
00049     // Convert mxArray to cv::Mat
00050     Mat img(rhs[0].toMat()), kernel(rhs[1].toMat());
00051     
00052     // Apply filter 2D
00053     // There seems to be a bug in filter when BORDER_CONSTANT is used
00054     filter2D(
00055         img,                    // src type
00056         img,                    // dst type
00057         ddepth,                 // dst depth
00058         kernel,                 // 2D kernel
00059         anchor,                 // anchor point, center if (-1,-1)
00060         delta,                  // bias added after filtering
00061         borderType                // border type
00062         );
00063     
00064     // Convert cv::Mat to mxArray
00065     plhs[0] = MxArray(img,rhs[0].classID());
00066 }
